8.14.20  9:04 pm   Okay, so we know you're good at everything about music: singing, playing a bunch of instruments, composing etc. You're also good at visual effects and now you're studying animation. So, on top of all of that, what other forms of art have you tried?

     Writing? Drawing?

     What is your opinion on creating stuff in general?
original_html:
8.14.20  9:04 pm   Okay, so we know you're good at everything about music: singing, playing a bunch of instruments, composing etc. You're also good at visual effects and now you're studying animation. So, on top of all of that, what other forms of art have you tried?

     Writing? Drawing?

     What is your opinion on creating stuff in general?

html: 8.14.20  8:57 pm   So like if I want to become a good violinist I practice scales every day. If I want to become good at sketching/painting I practice drawing lines and circles and human anatomy and stuff. These are exercises I do to learn/refine a technique in isolation of the actual music/art-making. Are there analogous drills for music composition and can you recommend any good ones?
original_html: 8.14.20  8:57 pm   So like if I want to become a good violinist I practice scales every day. If I want to become good at sketching/painting I practice drawing lines and circles and human anatomy and stuff.
